verses.verse: I say<WG2046> then,<WG3767> Has God<WG2316> cast<WG683> away<WG683> his people?<WG2992> God<WG3361> <WG1096> forbid.<WG3361> <WG1096> For I also<WG2532> am<WG1510> an Israelite,<WG2475> of the seed<WG4690> of Abraham,<WG11> of the tribe<WG5443> of Benjamin.<WG958>

God<WG2316> has not cast<WG683> away<WG683> his people<WG2992> which<WG3739> he foreknew.<WG4267> Know<WG1492> you not what<WG5101> the scripture<WG1124> said<WG3004> of Elias?<WG2243> how<WG5613> he makes<WG1793> intercession<WG1793> to God<WG2316> against<WG2596> Israel <WG2474>saying,<WG3004>
Lord,<WG2962> they have killed<WG615> your prophets,<WG4396> and dig<WG2679> down<WG2679> your<WG4675> altars;<WG2379> and I am left<WG5275> alone,<WG3441> and they seek<WG2212> my life.<WG5590>

But what<WG5101> said<WG3004> the answer<WG5538> of God to him? I have reserved<WG2641> to myself<WG1683> seven<WG2035> thousand<WG2035> men,<WG435> who<WG3748> have not bowed<WG2578> the knee<WG1119> to the image of Baal.<WG896>
Even<WG2532> so<WG3779> then<WG3767> at<WG1722> this<WG3588> present<WG3568> time<WG2540> also<WG2532> there is a remnant<WG3005> according<WG2596> to the election<WG1589> of grace.<WG5485>

And if<WG1487> by grace,<WG5485> then is it no<WG3765> more<WG2089> of works:<WG2041> otherwise<WG1893> grace<WG5485> is no<WG3765> more<WG2089> grace.<WG5485> But if<WG1487> it be of works,<WG2041> then it is no<WG3765> more<WG2089> grace:<WG5485> otherwise<WG1893> work<WG2041> is no<WG3765> more<WG2089> work.<WG2041>

What<WG5101> then?<WG3767> Israel<WG2474> has not obtained<WG2013> that which<WG3739> he seeks<WG1934> for; but the election<WG1589> has obtained<WG2013> it, and the rest<WG3062> were blinded.<WG4456>

(According<WG2531> as it is written,<WG1125> God<WG2316> has given<WG1325> them the spirit<WG4151> of slumber,<WG2659> eyes<WG3788> that they should not see,<WG991> and ears<WG3775> that they should not hear;<WG191>) to this<WG4594> day.<WG2250>
And David<WG1138> said,<WG3004> Let their table<WG5132> be made<WG1096> a snare,<WG3803> and a trap,<WG2339> and a stumbling block,<WG4625> and a recompense<WG468> to them:
Let their eyes<WG3788> be darkened,<WG4654> that they may not see,<WG991> and bow<WG4781> down<WG4781> their back<WG3577> always.<WG1275>

I say<WG2046> then,<WG3767> Have they stumbled<WG4417> that they should fall?<WG4098> God<WG3361> <WG1096> forbid:<WG3361> <WG1096> but rather through their fall<WG3900> salvation<WG4991> is come to the Gentiles,<WG1484> for to provoke<WG3863> them to jealousy.

Now<WG1161> if<WG1487> the fall<WG3900> of them be the riches<WG4149> of the world,<WG2889> and the diminishing<WG2275> of them the riches<WG4149> of the Gentiles;<WG1484> how<WG4214> much<WG4214> more<WG3123> their fullness?<WG4138>
For I speak<WG3004> to you Gentiles,<WG1484> inasmuch<WG1909> <WG3745> as I am<WG1510> the apostle<WG652> of the Gentiles,<WG1484> I magnify<WG1392> my<WG3450> office:<WG1248>
If<WG1513> by any<WG4458> means<WG4458> I may provoke<WG3863> to emulation<WG3863> them which are my flesh,<WG4561> and might save<WG4982> some<WG5100> of them.
For if<WG1487> the casting<WG580> away<WG580> of them be the reconciling<WG2643> of the world,<WG2889> what<WG5101> shall the receiving<WG4356> of them be, but life<WG2222> from the dead?<WG3498>
For if<WG1487> the first fruit<WG536> be holy,<WG40> the lump<WG5445> is also<WG2532> holy:<WG40> and if<WG1487> the root<WG4491> be holy,<WG40> so<WG2532> are the branches.<WG2798>

And if<WG1487> some<WG5100> of the branches<WG2798> be broken<WG1575> off,<WG1575> and you, being<WG5607> a wild<WG65> olive<WG65> tree,<WG65> were grafted<WG1461> in among<WG1722> them, and with them partake<WG1096> <WG4791> of the root<WG4491> and fatness<WG4096> of the olive<WG1636> tree;
Boast<WG2620> not against<WG2620> the branches.<WG2798> But if<WG1487> you boast, you bore<WG941> not the root,<WG4491> but the root<WG4491> you.
You will say<WG2046> then,<WG3767> The branches<WG2798> were broken<WG1575> off,<WG1575> that I might be grafted<WG1461> in.
Well;<WG2573> because of unbelief<WG570> they were broken<WG1575> off,<WG1575> and you stand<WG2476> by faith.<WG4102> Be not high minded,<WG5309> but fear:<WG5399>
For if<WG1487> God<WG2316> spared<WG5339> not the natural<WG2596> <WG5449> branches,<WG2798> take heed<WG3708> lest<WG3381> he also<WG3761> spare<WG5339> not you.

Behold<WG1492> therefore<WG3767> the goodness<WG5544> and severity<WG663> of God:<WG2316> on<WG1909> them which fell,<WG4098> severity;<WG663> but toward<WG1909> you, goodness,<WG5544> if<WG1437> you continue<WG1961> in his goodness:<WG5544> otherwise<WG1893> you also<WG2532> shall be cut<WG1581> off.<WG1581>
And they also,<WG1161> if<WG1437> they abide<WG1961> not still in unbelief,<WG570> shall be grafted<WG1461> in: for God<WG2316> is able<WG1415> to graft<WG1461> them in again.<WG3825>

For if<WG1487> you were cut<WG1581> out of the olive<WG65> tree<WG65> which is wild<WG65> by nature,<WG5449> and were grafted<WG1461> contrary<WG3844> to nature<WG5449> into<WG1519> a good<WG2565> olive<WG2565> tree:<WG2565> how<WG4214> much<WG4214> more<WG3123> shall these,<WG3778> which be the natural<WG2596> <WG5449> branches,<WG2798> be grafted<WG1461> into their own<WG2398> olive<WG1636> tree?

For I would<WG2309> not, brothers,<WG80> that you should be ignorant<WG50> of this<WG5124> mystery,<WG3466> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> you should be wise<WG5429> in your<WG3844> <WG1438> own<WG1438> conceits;<WG3844> <WG1438> that blindness<WG4457> in part<WG3313> is happened<WG1096> to Israel,<WG2474> until<WG891> the fullness<WG4138> of the Gentiles<WG1484> be come<WG1525> in.

And so<WG3779> all<WG3956> Israel<WG2474> shall be saved:<WG4982> as it is written,<WG1125> There shall come<WG2240> out of Sion<WG4622> the Deliverer,<WG4506> and shall turn<WG654> away<WG654> ungodliness<WG763> from Jacob:<WG2384>
For this<WG3778> is my covenant<WG1242> to them, when<WG3752> I shall take<WG851> away<WG851> their sins.<WG266>
As concerning<WG2596> the gospel,<WG2098> they are enemies<WG2190> for your<WG5209> sakes: but as touching<WG2596> the election,<WG1589> they are beloved<WG27> for the father's<WG3962> sakes.
For the gifts<WG5486> and calling<WG2821> of God<WG2316> are without<WG278> repentance.<WG278>
For as you in times<WG4218> past have not believed<WG544> God,<WG2316> yet have now<WG3568> obtained<WG1653> mercy<WG1653> through their unbelief:<WG543>
Even so<WG3779> have these<WG3778> also<WG2532> now<WG3568> not believed,<WG544> that through your<WG5212> mercy<WG1656> they also<WG2532> may obtain<WG1653> mercy.<WG1653>
For God<WG2316> has concluded<WG4788> them all<WG3956> in unbelief,<WG543> that he might have mercy<WG1653> on all.<WG3956>

O the depth<WG899> of the riches<WG4149> both<WG2532> of the wisdom<WG4678> and knowledge<WG1108> of God!<WG2316> how<WG5613> unsearchable<WG419> are his judgments,<WG2917> and his ways<WG3598> past<WG421> finding<WG421> out!
For who<WG5101> has known<WG1097> the mind<WG3563> of the Lord?<WG2962> or<WG2228> who<WG5101> has been<WG1096> his counselor?<WG4825>
Or<WG2228> who<WG5101> has first<WG4272> given<WG4272> to him, and it shall be recompensed<WG467> to him again?<WG467>
For of him, and through<WG1223> him, and to him, are all<WG3956> things: to whom<WG846> be glory<WG1391> for ever.<WG165> Amen.<WG281>
